p:
Viral phylogenetics revealed two predominant patterns of HIV-1 spread among MSM in Quebec. Half of new infections were associated with singleton/small cluster networks (cluster size 1â€“4), while 30 viruses (1.7% of viral lineages) resulted in micro-epidemics, averaging 40 transmissions/cluster (Figure 1).
45 Viruses within both cluster groups were isolated to compare viral escape from antiretroviral pressure.
